caption:
ğŸ“hot hideout mala @ahothideout (semb)!

one of the most famous and most classic malas out there!

we ordered their signature mala collagen soup as well as their dry mala, with their scrambled eggs and their deep fried ingredients(potatoes, luncheon meat, and fish). what can I say? this tasted like HEAVENNNNğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ their mala collagen soup was super savoury and indulgent. the taste of the mala was not too overwhelming and itâ€™s just nice for me! i can easily say that this is one of the best mala soups Iâ€™ve ever tried! as someone who was never a fan of mala tangs, this definitely converted me. come down and try it for urselves! would easily give this an 8/10.

as for their mala, thereâ€™s nth really special as compared to other mala places you can find in Singapore, but what makes them stand out would be their deep fried ingredients and scrambled eggs. the deep fried potatoes were especially crispy till the point where you can hear the KRAK KRAK sounds when you bite down on it!! THIS IS A MUST GET WHEN GOING HHO!! their deep fried luncheon meat and their deep fried fish also goes well with mala. the fried luncheon meat was full of flavour and their deep fried fish was soft and tasty. do rmbr to get bigger slices for the fish because when they deep fry it, the pieces get smaller!!! ğŸ¤”ğŸ¤”ğŸ¤” 

I did not really understand the idea of scrambled eggs with mala at first, but I was WOWED when I had my first mouth of their scrambled eggs alongside the mala tang! THE EGGS WERE SERVED AS DESCRIBED! IT WAS SOFT, FLUFFY AND HAD A CREAMY TEXTURE! its a must order for me regardless of whether Iâ€™m eating dry or soup. It will make the whole experience better!!! ğŸ˜‰ğŸ˜‰ğŸ˜‰

what makes hho stand out from the other mala stores would be the fact that they offer deep fried options for these ingredients. I went to one of the thye guan mala outlets that day and they unfortunately could not deep fry itğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚. WHAT R U WAITING FOR LADIES AND GENTLEMEN GO AND EAT HHO IF U HAVENT!!! ğŸ˜ŠWE R IN 2024!!! 

#food #foodporn #singapore #singaporefood #singaporefoodie #ilovefood #iloveeating #eat #mala #ahothideout #ahothideoutsg

ğŸ“brothers ramen @brosramen @ international plaza!!

I CAN VOUCH ON MY LIFE THAT THIS IS THE BEST RAMEN IN THE WHOLE OF SINGAPORE!!! ğŸ˜‰ğŸ˜‰ğŸ˜‰

As an ultimate ramen loverğŸ¤¤, I can say that this ramen is 1000000000000000000000000000000000000000/10. 
I came here over 10 times and this is the first time I got the megamen as I wanted a switch from my usual signature brothers ramen. What can I say. This bowl of noodles is the most perfect bowl of noodles you can find in SG. ğŸ˜„ The broth is insanely thick and the flavour is super duper good. U know ur eating  REAL, LEGIT ramen when you eat at brothers ramen. I added spice cos Iâ€™m a spice lover and oh my god. Itâ€™s GOD tier. The nooodles also super QQ. I even added noodles and I absolutely destroyed the whole bowl(on my story). DO NOT CALL URSELF A RAMEN LOVER IF U NEVER EAT BROTHERS RAMEN. 

As for their signature brothers ramen, it has more soup and more like traditional ramen. (Slide 678). As you can clearly see, the egg alrdy looks bussin. The whole bowl is cooked to perfection. I always add noodles and finish the whole bowl. But I donâ€™t care cos itâ€™s BROTHERS RAMENğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥. I think this would be more suitable to everyone as itâ€™s less salty compared to the megamen, because the megamen has less soup. But again, you can adjust the saltiness level of ur ramen while ordering, so you have not excuses not to come here. ğŸ˜‰

For the price of only 13.90 each for such a big bowl of megamen and brothers ramen, and the fact that itâ€™s located RIGHT SMACK in the middle of cbd, there is really nth u can complain about. And this ramen store opens only from 11-2.45pm and 6-7.45pm, and yet their queues are insane. I rmbr having to queue over like 1 hour one time. But I donâ€™t care because I love brothers ramen. And I love being a fatty Bom Bom. 
And Ok, Iâ€™m gonna be honest, u already know itâ€™s good when you see actual JAPANESE people queueing for this ramen shop. This is the ONLY shop in Singapore where I see Japanese ppl queueing for the food. So yall better come down and try. Donâ€™t say BOJIO. LET ME SAY THIS AGAIN. BEST RAMEN IN SINGAPORE!!! ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

#singapore #ramen #singaporefood #food #ilovefood #foodporn #instagood

ğŸ“Founders Bak Kut Teh 

Def one of the best Bak Kut Teh restaurants in Singapore!! 

Ordered their â€œFounder Popularity Bak Kut Tehâ€(slide 2) and and their â€œFounder Bak Kut Tehâ€ (slide 4) and safe to say their meat is super duper tender!! ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹The meat was also super fresh and did not have any foul smell to it. Quality of the meat is definitely there, way better than the average Bak Kut teh chains u can find in shopping malls. ğŸ¤£

Really love their soup as well, super rich in flavour. One thing that stands out for the soup will be the peppery taste it has, def makes the soup a lil bit more spicy, but it also makes it way more flavourful. The long-simmered pork ribs infuse the soup with a deep umami taste, balanced by the warm sweetness of the garlic. Def must come here if youâ€™re looking for good BKT!! ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

Their side dishes, such as the salted veg and youtiao were pretty good as well! Tho the youtiao didnâ€™t have anything special to it, the salted vegs packs a garlicky flavour, with the right amount of saltiness. Worth ordering!! ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°ğŸ¥°

Overall, Founders Bak Kut Teh offers a very traditional and authentic dining experience. I would say itâ€™s worth travelling down and enjoy a good bowl of Bak Kut teh, so come down for urselves and try it!! ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€

#singapore #food #foodporn #foodphotography #foodstagram #sg #sgfood #sgfoodie #goodfood #chinesefood #ilovefood #foodie #sgeats #sgfoodlover #singaporefood #chinesefoodlover #tourism

ğŸ“Roland ZiChar Restaurant

Located in the East side of Singapore, this seafood Zichar restaurant is known especially for its chili crab!! (Itâ€™s said that this restaurant is the BIRTHPLACE of Chili crab itself, soâ€¦ u can expect super good Chili crab here ğŸ˜ğŸ˜)

Their chili crab is definitely the best dish here. The crab was fresh, meat was tender, and sauce was super rich in flavour. ğŸ˜±ğŸ˜±ğŸ˜±It had the right amount of spice in it and the egg in the sauce gave it a silky and creamy texture. ğŸ˜†ğŸ˜†ğŸ˜† Definitely a dish worth ordering when you are here!!

Their other seafood dishes(black sauce prawns on slide 4 and their sea bass on slide 10) were amazing as well! Black sauce had a savoury sweet bland, where they combined soy sauce together with other aromatics to create this layer of glaze that clings to each prawn!! Prawns used were big too! ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ Loved their fish as well, the soup wasnâ€™t too strong nor too bland. Fish was cooked to perfection ğŸ˜

Overall, this place definitely serves super good and high quality zichar with reasonable and large portions, though it may def be on the pricier side.(got the special birthday menu that day!) Do come down and give it a try, ESPECIALLY THEIR CHILI CRAB!! RLLY THINK THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST CHILLI CRABS IVE EATEN HAHAHAHAHA

#food #foodgasm #seafood #seafoodlovers #singapore #singaporefood #sgfood #instagram #insta #goodfood #ilovefood #hiddengem #restaurant #chilicrab #zichar #foodies #foodie

ğŸ“Tiantai Hotpot (shanyuzhong)

Located at the rooftop of people park complex, this restaurant serves authentic Chongqing hotpot!The space also matches the vibe of Chongqing as well!(hearsay the owner of this restaurant was from Chongqing as wellğŸ˜) 

The star of the show is definitely the Mala soup base! Super thick and rich in flavour, and mad spicy as well(they have options till weiweila for those who canâ€™t take spice!) 

Their dishes are super affordable as well ğŸ˜Œone plate of meat costs roughly 9$! Meat was super fresh as well, especially their beef (pic3). Super tender and flavourful!!ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€
The veg also quite cheap, with their  potato slices at 1$ and enoki mushrooms at only 4$! ğŸ¤¯ğŸ¤¯ğŸ¤¯ 

Lastly, their brown sugar jelly is a must get when you head down to this restaurant! At only 1$, this bowl of brown sugar jelly with raisins inside is the perfect desert after a hot and spicy meal of hotpot! Def a must try!! ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥

Overall would give this place a 8.5/10! Super affordable for a place located in town, def a good and affordable alternative! 

#singapore #singaporefood #food #foodie #ilovefood #foodporn #instagood #sgfood #sgfoodie #dinner #hotpot #hotpotğŸ²

ğŸ“ramen bari-uma (273 Thomson Road)

came across this on tiktok saying this is the richest tonkotsu ramen in sgâ€¦ so OBVIOUSLY bro had to go down and try it ğŸ˜›ğŸ˜›ğŸ˜› 

we ordered the ajitama-uma($15.90) and karatama-uma($17.90), with a plate of chashu($10.90), edamame($4.00) and their pan fried gyoza($7.90). 

the ramen broth was SUPER DUPER THICC and the noodles were super tangy as well!! The taste was super balanced,not too salty yet still tasty. ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ The chashu was also frickin tender ğŸ¤©ğŸ¤©, probably one of the BEST, if not the BEST chashu Iâ€™ve eaten in a ramen ngl. The egg was also super runny, loved the consistency of it and how itâ€™s cooked to perfection ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜. If you are looking for something spicy, then definitely get the spicy one. SUPER FLAVORFULğŸ˜™ğŸ˜™ğŸ˜™. Donâ€™t believe me? See pic 8 for evidence ğŸ˜

Their pan-fried Gyozas are also a MUST GET WHEN UR THERE!! The amazing chaoda and crispy layer at the bottom makes the gyoza 1000000x better. PROMISE ITS GOOD!!! ğŸ‘ Not to forget their edamame also rocks.(not sure why, my mom said itâ€™s nice so i will just add it here lol)

Overall, would give this place an 8/10!! The store was super vibes and reminded me a lil bit of japan ğŸ˜‚ Def one of the better bowls of ramen you can have in sg, tho it may be a lil pricey for the location(thatâ€™s the price u have to pay for good food igğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚) I will def be back here again to have more ramen HAHA. Come down and try it for urselves ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

#food #goodfood #dinner #supper #ilovefood #instagram #foodporn #foodie #foodstagram #foodblogger #ramen #iloveramenğŸœ #singapore #sg #sgfood #sgfoodie #sgfoodies #sgeats #instafood #foodies

ğŸ“DLLM Lok Lok 

Tried their loklok for the first time and I can say this is the best loklok Iâ€™ve tried in SG!!(better than the dacheng sg outlet )ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

Ordered a few different items but what stood out to me was their broccoli! As someone who dislikes broccoliğŸ˜¤, gawddamn it was bussin HAHA. Super crispy and when added together with their seasoning, it def hits the right spots ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥

Their pork belly with enoki mushrooms are worth mentioning as well. Deep fried enoki mushrooms give a super crunchy texture when u bite down on it, with their juicy pork belly ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨. Definitely a must get!!

And they also offer maggi mee with egg at 2.50$ only! Though itâ€™s just maggi mee, it was super vibes and it came well together when eating loklok. Highly recommend the curry flavour one especially ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

Overall I wld rate this an 8/10! A super good dinner/supper spot that opens till 4am. Their loklok is also SUPER DUPER CHEAP at only 1$ per stick! And ofc their hilarious NSFW designs (pic6 onwards) Do give this place a try!! ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

#food #foodphotography #foodporn #foodstagram #foodblogger #loklok #singapore #singaporefood #sg #sgfood #sgfoodie #sgfoodies #sgeats #ilovefood #supper #dinner #goodfood

ğŸ“xiao long kan hotpot @ orchard!

wanted something different from the basic haidilao, so tried this hotpot instead!

we ordered their mala soup, tomato soup and pork bone soup. their mala soup was super duper spicy but quite good actually!(resembles more of China type of hotpot where the soup is super oily.) remember to get å°è¾£if u canâ€™t take spiceğŸ˜­ğŸ”¥. the pork bone soup was quite flavorful as well, and had a ton of ingredients. as for their tomato soup, it was alright and nothing special(still prefer my haidilaoğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚)

As for the ingredients, we ordered their beef, pork and some veg. The beef (slide 3) and the pork(slide 4-6) were both super good! The meat was super tender and fresh, and the marbling of the meat ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨ quality of the meat felt very premium as well!! (Tho we paid a lot for itâ€¦ğŸ˜¢)

Overall I would say that this place is quite expensive(paid 276$ for 6 peopleâ€¦) and not worth comingğŸ¥² . There was nothing very special about this hotpot place and we did not feel full after the meal as we only ordered a few plates of meat. Not the best hotpot experience HAHAHA ig i will just stick to my usual haidilao or beauty in the pot.

#food #foodie #foodporn #foodphotography #foodstagram #foodblogger #sg #sgfood #sgfoodie #ilovefood #singapore #singaporefood #hotpot #china #chinatown #xiaolongkan #soup

ğŸ“bhc chicken ( @bhc_chicken_sg ) at Marina Square!

wanted to try this for the longest time alreadyâ€¦ and @nonsenseeaterr finally agreed to it ğŸ¥³ğŸ¥³ğŸ¥³

we ordered their bburinkle half chicken(14.90$) and the red king half chicken(23.90$). The bburinkle chicken was super delicious and had lots of cheese and vegetable seasoning that made the chicken super flavorful. Cheese seasoning was not too thicc, so wonâ€™t feel jelat when eating it!! ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ As a fried chicken lover, I will rate this an 8/10! Will definitely order this if I come here again! 

The red king chicken was surprisingly good as well(super underrated!!). It was spicy(not say too spicy), but also had a bit of sweetness as well! The garlic added also made the chicken way more yummy. For those who love spicy food, I would recommend getting this! (Tho it may be slightly pricyğŸ˜…) This is an 8/10 for me as well! ğŸ˜„ğŸ˜„ 

Overall, this place is worth a try!! The quality of the chicken was super duper good(chicken came hot and juicy ğŸ˜›ğŸ˜›ğŸ˜›) and itâ€™s no doubt better than most of the fried chicken we have in SG. Definitely reminds me of the bhc chicken I had in Koreaâ€¦ ğŸ¥¹  Will come back again and try the other flavours and dishes as well.ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€

#food #foodporn #foodphotography #foodstagram #foodblogger #chicken #chickenwings #friedchicken #instagood #ilovefood #foodie #sg #sgfood #sgfoodie #bhcchicken #sgeats

ğŸ“Dai Tao Lala Pot @ mount austin jb!!

Have been wanting to try this for the longest time and I can say this definitely did not disappoint ğŸ«¨ğŸ«¨ğŸ«¨

We ordered their daitao signature soup and OMG!! The soup was super sweet and super delicious. It definitely exceeded my expectationsğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹. The flavour of the soup was really on point, not too bland or salty!! You can add the wine (èŠ±é›•é…’) into the soup which makes the soup way more flavourful. Add in abit of garlic and chilli padi and the soup IS PERFECT ğŸ¤—ğŸ¤—. The soup is easily 9/10!! Must get this when you come.  And of course not forgetting the clams! Thereâ€™s arnd 1kg worth of lala inside, which I feel is just nice for 2-3 people.

For the ingredients, we ordered their pork shoulder slice, marbled pork slice, chicken slice, signature fish paste and some vegetables. All the meat were super fresh and portions were big as well compared to sgğŸ˜‚ 

Overall, I feel this place is a must try! Itâ€™s cheap compared to the ones we have in Singapore. (spent around 150rm for 2, so roughly 25$ SGD per person) However, the downside will be that there may be long queues during dinner hours and weekends, so make sure to come early to avoid the queue!! It also opens till 3am, so it can be a good supper spot if youâ€™re planning to go jb and have some good foodğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ Can get quite hot sometimes when you are eating as ur outdoors, but no complains cos food is BUSSIN ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ I will definitely come back again!! Overall 8/10. 

#food #foodporn #ilovefood #singapore #hotpot #sg #malaysiafood #singaporefood #foodie #jb #sgfood #daitaolalapot #foodgasm #foodpics #singaporefoodie

ğŸ“keens bagelry ( @keensbagelry )

friend of mine brought me down to try this place and I can easily say that no other store in sg has bagels better than here!!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹THIS IS A COMPLETELY HONEST REVIEW.

NOSTALGIA: 8.9/10!! I loved everything about this... the crispy golden brown hashbrowns paired with the lettuce and the luncheon meat ğŸ«¨ğŸ«¨ğŸ«¨ together with the sunny side up and cheddar cheeseğŸ§€ğŸ˜ğŸ¤© it was the perfect
mix!!

LOXU: 9/10!!!!! IF YOU LOVE SALMON AND CREAM CHEESE YOU MUST GET THIS!! They were super generous with the salmon, and the smoked salmon was super fresh and balanced, without an overpowering fish smell. The best part about this is the ratio of the cream cheese to salmon. The cream cheese is not too strong, so even for people who are not a big fan of cream cheese(Eg me), you can still ENJOY the whole masterpiece without it feeling jelat or oily. The onions and the tomatoes also brought extra flavour. U HAVE TO TRY THIS!!! ğŸ˜‡ğŸ˜‡ğŸ˜‡

Of course you cannot forget the bagels themselves!! The bagels here are really super good. Super crunchy exterior with a soft, dense and slightly sweet interior. ğŸ˜šThere are
3 bagel types to choose from as well!! We got the plain one and I can already say that itâ€™s alrdy super delicious. Will definitely come down again to try the sesame one!!

Located in the CBD area, with their big ass bagels priced at only 13-16$, I would say that this is a STEAL!! I promise you that the bagels are bigger than what it looks like in pictures and that itâ€™s definitely worth ur money!! ğŸ¤—ğŸ¤—ğŸ¤—COME DOWN AND TRY!!! ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

#sg #sgfood #bagel #bagels #cafe #cafeteria #food #foodporn #foodphotography #foodstagram #foodblogger #goodfood #ilovefood #instagram #foodie #singapore #singaporefoodie #foodislife

ğŸ“Little Glass Stand

Located right smack in the middle of CBD(2 mins walk from Raffles Place MRT), this place offers a wide variety of matcha! We got the Tenerai Matcha Latte and the Wakaba Matcha Latte. 

The Tenerai Matcha Latte was a 6/10 for me. Tho I can taste the authenticity of the matcha, it was not anything too special for me. It was said to be light and refreshing as well, but I felt that the Wakaba Matcha Latte was more refreshing insteadğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚. For the price of 8.90$, I feel that it did not live up to its price point ğŸ˜“

The Wakaba Matcha Latte was a 7/10 for me. It felt super refreshing when drinking, followed by a strong matcha aftertaste which I prefer more over the other one. I would say that the Wakaba is a better option if you are planning to head down here!!

Overall, as a matcha lover, I would say that the quality of matcha here is decent, but for the price im paying, I wouldnâ€™t say itâ€™s exactly worth it. (Maybe when im employed then itâ€™s different). My go to will still be HVALA HAHAHA! Anyways come down and give it a try if you are around the area!! 

#food #foodporn #foodie #singapore #sg #sgfood #drinks #drink #cafe #latte #matcha #matchalatte #matchalover #cafehopping #singaporelife #foodgasm #drinkcoffee #drinktea #coffeelovers

ğŸ“common grill by Collinâ€™s (Marsiling coffeeshop) 

Easily one of the best western food Iâ€™ve ever had!! And itâ€™s in a coffeeshop!!!

Stumbled across this when I was walking around looking for food in Marsiling, and GAWD DAMN this western food is LIFE CHANGING ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨ğŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨. We ordered their chicken cutlet with pasta, their carbonara, and their crispy onion rings.  The chicken cutlet was legit super crispy and the pasta was cooked to perfection. Easily already a 7/10. The highlight of this dish however would be the tartar sauce. I expected the tartar sauce to taste like McD fillet o fish sauce(I hate that), but omg the sauce was legit so so delicious. It had a similar taste to wingstop ranch, but itâ€™s texture is not as thick. When paired with the chicken, it easily brings this dish up to a 9/10!! ğŸ«¨ğŸ«¨ğŸ«¨ 

The carbonara was also CRAZY. The RICH, CREAMY sauce and the Al Dente pasta paired with the super flavourful bacon ğŸ¥“â€¦ this dish is definitely on another level!!! I am not a carbonara fan but I can vouch that you MUST have this when you come here!! Itâ€™s hard to explain through wordsâ€¦ so come and try it for urselves ğŸ«¢ğŸ«¢ğŸ«¢. For the price of only 9.90$, u canâ€™t get any better carbonara out there!! 

Onion rings were also super crispy as well. Came with fries, but nothing really special about it. Just ur standard sides I guess ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚.

Overall, I would give this place a 7.5/10 and I will definitely come back again!! Especially since itâ€™s located in a coffeeshop and that itâ€™s cheaper than other western food u can find in shopping malls. For its quality, this is definitely better than any western food u can find in coffee shops. This is a HIDDEN GEM ğŸ’ for me. Do try it if you are in the area and I promise u wonâ€™t regret ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

#food #foodporn #foodphotography #foodstagram #singapore #sg #sgfood #sgfoodie #goodfood #westernfood #ilovefood #foodie #sgeats #sgfoodlover #singaporefood

ğŸ“ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ lake bake cafe @mtfuji!! 

located near mt fuji (lake kawaguchiko area), this place is a must for every pastry lover out there!! ğŸ¤©ğŸ¤© thereâ€™s a wide selection of bread here, and I can guarantee u that almost everything is good (because we got almost everything there is ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚) The bread here is super fresh and soft, and itâ€™s even better to have it on site, where they will help you heat the bread up ğŸ†™. special shoutout to the U Shaped bread in pic 3(forgot what it is) for being extra good ğŸ˜. 

This place is also super vibes as well! There are seats outside of the cafe that allow you to enjoy ur bread with the mighty Mount fuji in front of you. ğŸ—» Please come here if you are ever visiting mt fuji!! Will rate this place a 8/10. 

#food #foodporn #foodstagram #ilovefood #travel #japan #japantrip #japanfood #singapore #singaporefood #sg #sgfood #sgfoodie #foodie #foodphotography #japanesefood #foodisgood #tasty #pastry #bread

ğŸ“ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ The PARK cafe @lake yamanaka area beside mt fuji!!

Pt 2 of everything I had in Japan!! (FUJI editionğŸ˜ğŸ˜)

Saw this place on my lemon8 and TikTok, so had no choice but to head down and give it a try. This place did NOT disappoint!!! ğŸ˜‹ 

We ordered their signature pancake(pic 1 and 2) and tiramisu pancake(pic 3 and 4). OMG they were so fluffy and soft this is legit the first time I come across pancakes with such texture. The tiramisu pancakes also came with a coffee dip. When dipped inside, you can taste the well mixed flavours of the coffee and tiramisu. SUPER GOOD!! I would easily rate the pancakes here an 8/10.  For the price of only 1180yen for their original pancakes(around 11-12SGD~), itâ€™s better than any of the pancakes I had in sg!! 

Next up we ordered their hot chocolate and I was WOWed by it!! The chocolate was super GAO(thick) and not too sweet. JUST NICE for my taste budsğŸ˜. I recommend getting this when the weather is super chilly (the day we went it was 20-21degrees) and I promise u confirm drink until SHIOKKKKK. 

This place is a must visit when you are coming to Japan and mt fuji area!! The highlight of this cafe is that they have outdoor seats(where Iâ€™m sitting) that provide you with panoramic views of Mount fuji and lake yamanaka. Unfortunately when we arrived to this cafe, the clouds were blocking MT Fuji so we couldnâ€™t see itâ€¦ğŸ˜­ but nonetheless this place is still super vibes!! Fun fact if you come during the winter at around 830am or 4pm, thereâ€™s a chance you get to see swans in the lake right in front of u ğŸ˜±ğŸ˜±ğŸ˜± Do drop by when you are visiting Mount fuji!! ğŸ¤©

#food #foodporn #foodstagram #sgfood #japan #japanesefood #mountfuji #lakeyamanaka #goodfood #ilovefood #pancakes #pancakelover #bussin #singapore #singaporefood #instagood #foodie

ğŸ“ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ

food dump!! (Pt 1) everything that I had in Japan! 

Japanese food is so yumz I can literally eat all these everydayâ€¦ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ special shoutout to family mart and lawson chicken for being so good I ate it at least 2 times everydayâ€¦. (Family mart>lawson>7-11)

And a random izakaya shop that we passed by in the middle of gunma which offered super delicious food(pics 1-5). Their tap beer was super duper good as well! I asked the staff what beer it was and it was premium kirin lager so do try it out if yall r in japanğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ OTHER BEERS THAT I wld recommend include the famous asahi super dry beer and the Suntory premium malts beer. Those tasted super good as well and I would definitely prefer that over the
ones we have in sg, so TRY IT!!! ğŸ»ğŸ»ğŸ»

PSA: for all the beer lovers out there, do rmbr to get tap beer when yall head into Japanese restaurants as their beer tastes 10 times better than the cans ones!! 

ofc ichiran ramen is another one of my all time favourites. itâ€™s a must for me to get the whole set(extra chashu, egg, seaweed and drink) alongside with the extra noodles whenever I come to Japan. and if you scroll to pic 18, u can see my bowl is completely empty cos I ate it all up. tho it may be on the pricier side(lowkey tourist trapğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­), it is definitely an experience to get it when you come here!! ğŸ˜œ

when coming to Tokyo, rmbr to head to asakusa temple,  where the streeets are filled with super good food as well!! (Pics 19 and 20) got the chocolate mochi and oh my god. This was insane!! ğŸ“Xiang Xiang hunan cuisine @causewaypointsg !!

a good place to get China food to satisfy your cravings!!

This was honestly super good ğŸ‘ The herbs together with the garlic made the whole dish smell fantastic. The dish fried together with the chili also makes it 10 times more flavorful. Easily an 8/10 for me!! ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

The hunan style stir fried pork (pics 3 and 4) is also another must order when you come here!! The wok hey was super strong, and the texture of the meat was soft and tender. Fried together with the sauce, and paired with rice, this dish is a BANGERRRRRR. Honestly the taste of their stir fried pork reminded me of the stir fried pork I ate recently in ChinağŸ˜®â€ğŸ’¨ I would say this dish is an easy 8/10 as well. Please get this when you come here!!!ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥

The last dish we ordered was the sour and spicy potatoes, which was super disappointing as wellâ€¦ğŸ˜® I personally am not a fan of the potatoes as itâ€™s way too sour to my likings. This is a 4/10 for me ğŸ˜”

THIS IS A MUST TRY!!!!

this place showed up on my å°çº¢ä¹¦all the time while doing my research for the trip, so I headed down to this place and it definitely DID NOT disappoint! 

we ordered their basic xlbs, their crab roe xlbs, and the pork cutlet. their basic xlbs were already amazing! the soup tasted super good and the skin was also very chewy. definitely better than the ones we have in sg. 

next up their pork cutlets were SUPER crispy as well! A golden-brown crunchy crust on the outside, with tender and a soft texture thatâ€™s easy to bite into. For the price of 15-20yuan, it was definitely worth getting. Would rate this a solid 9/10!

last but not least, THE cream of the crop, the crab roe XLBs!!!! The XLBS were filled with rich, vibrant orange crab roe.
